projects.title: C2ME Culturally Competent in Medical Education
projects.description:
C2ME aims towards culturally competent medical teachers and effective implementation of cultural competence in medical curricula. Medical teachers and medical school leadership are the main target group of C2ME. Medical curricula should include cultural competence as a strategy to address cultural differences in health and health care. Cultural includes dimensions such as ethnicity, religion, migrant status, gender, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status, and language. 

The project is an Erasmus LLP project and runs from 2013-2015. Join our group on LinkedIN!

projects.title: HOUPE II
projects.description: The Health and Organisation among University Hospital Project (HOUPE) (www.houpe.no) aims to study the impact of work organization, career development, work-family conflict on the health of specialists working in academic hospitals. HOUPE is an international study and uses a quantitative, longitudinal study design that is based on a theoretical model to explain the relations between gender, work organization, career development, work-family conflict, and mental health. The project is hosted by the Centre for Gender Medicine at Karolinska Institute. HOUPE is a collaborative project between Karolinska Institute Stockholm, Sweden, Centre of Gender Medicine at Padua University Hospital and Padua University, Italy, Landspitali University Hospital Rykjavik, Iceland, St Olavs University Hospital/Norwegian University of Science and Technology, Trondheim, Norway, Semmelweis University Hospital Budapest, Hungary, VU University Medical Center. International projectleader is Dr. Ann Fridner, Karolinska Institute.

profile_positions.description: The WHO Academy is the World Health Organization’s state-of-the-art lifelong learning centre, bringing the very latest innovations in adult learning to global health.  Now under development with the support of France, the Academy will scale up learning for impact through online, in-person and blended learning programmes, reaching millions of health workers and others all over the world.  Using the latest technologies, it will enable all learners to tailor their learning experiences to meet their own needs and award them digital credentials they can use to verify their competencies and advance their careers.
